articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Qatar-mediated negotiations between Israel and Hamas aimed at de-escalating fighting in Gaza continued on Saturday, a source briefed on the negotiations said, even as Israel intensified its assault on the enclave.
articles.title: Qatar-led negotiations between Israel and Hamas continue, source says

articles.author: Ece Toksabay, Dilara Senkaya
articles.description: President Tayyip Erdogan will join on Saturday what is expected to be one of the largest pro-Palestinian rallies since the Israel-Hamas war began, courting his Islamist political base a day ahead of the centenary of Turkey's secular republic.
articles.title: Erdogan to address pro-Palestinian rally on eve of Turkey's centenary

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's chief military spokesperson declined to say whether Israel was behind the telecommunications blackout that hit Gaza on Friday and which has left the besieged enclave largely cut off but said it would do what it needed to protect its forces.
articles.title: Israeli military, asked about Gaza coms blackout, says we do what needed to protect forces

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas was about to reach an agreement with Israel over the hostages held by the Palestinian militant faction but Israel had "stalled" on that possibility, a spokesman for the group's armed wing said on Saturday.
articles.title: Hamas armed wing says Israel 'stalled' on possible deal over hostages

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military said on Saturday it had stopped a surface-to-air missile fired from Lebanon at one of its drones and the Lebanese authorities issued precautionary guidance in case they have to evacuate Beirut airport, as border tensions rise.
articles.title: Israel stops missile from Lebanon, as Beirut takes airport precautions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The families of Israeli hostages held by Hamas in the Gaza Strip have been racked with worry for their loved ones since the military stepped up ground assaults inside the Palestinian territory, a group lobbying for the families said on Saturday.
articles.title: 'Anxiety' racks Israeli hostage families as army assaults Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of protesters demanding a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas forced the closure on Friday of Grand Central Terminal, one of New York City's major transit hubs, the Metropolitan Transportation Authority said.
articles.title: Protesters shut New York's Grand Central, seeking Gaza ceasefire

articles.author: Emily Rose
articles.description: Israeli forces waged ground operations against Hamas in Gaza on Sunday in what Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called the second phase of a three-week-old war aimed at crushing the Palestinian militant group.
articles.title: Israel presses ground campaign against Hamas in 'second stage' of Gaza war

articles.author: Gabriella Borter
articles.description: A U.S. Army reservist accused of spraying a bowling alley and bar with gunfire in Lewiston, Maine, killing 18 people, was found dead after a 48-hour manhunt, restoring calm to communities unnerved by the bloodshed but leaving many questions unanswered.
articles.title: US army reservist suspected in Lewiston, Maine, shootings found dead, likely suicide

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi said the "road to the San Francisco summit will not be a smooth one", the foreign ministry said on Sunday, in a reference to an expected meeting between President Xi Jinping and U.S. President Joe Biden.
articles.title: China's foreign minister suggests road to Xi-Biden summit will not be smooth
